question: Does the product gather specialized categories of personal data, such as biometric or health-related information?
Are there security protocols in place for safeguarding specialized categories of personal data?
Have you implemented measures to ensure only the essential sensitive personal data is collected?
Does the product collect information concerning criminal convictions or offenses?
Is the collection of such criminal data authorized by European Union or Member State law?
Is the registry of criminal convictions exclusively controlled by an official authority?
Are the objectives for collecting personal data clearly defined, explicit, and legitimate?
Is the acquired personal data strictly relevant and limited to what is essential for the intended purposes?
Is the personal data you gather accurate and regularly updated?
Is personal data stored in a way that allows for identification of subjects only for the duration needed for its intended use?
Do you employ a Data Protection Officer (DPO) in accordance with European Union or Member State legislation?
Is the DPO actively involved in all data protection matters?
Does the DPO have a direct reporting line to the highest level of management?
Is adequate resourcing provided for the DPO to execute their tasks?
Is the DPO free from instructions that could compromise the impartial exercise of their responsibilities?
Can data subjects directly communicate with the DPO regarding their personal data processing concerns?
Are there methods to authenticate the identity of a data subject requesting access?
Are the identity verification methods you employ both secure and reliable?
Do you employ pseudonymization techniques as part of the identity verification process?
Is personal data only retained for the purpose of responding to potential future requests?
Does the product support the "right to be forgotten," allowing for the erasure of personal data?
Can a data subject request erasure under some specified conditions?
Can erasure be requested for data that is no longer necessary?
Is erasure possible when the data subject withdraws consent and there’s no other legal ground for processing?
Can erasure be requested if the data subject contests the processing and no overriding legitimate reasons exist?
Can erasure be executed when the personal data has been unlawfully processed?
Is erasure possible to comply with legal obligations?
Can erasure be requested for data gathered when the subject was a minor?
Is all data processing information transparent and easily accessible to data subjects?
Is data processing information also available in electronic formats?
Is data processing information articulated in clear language that is easily understandable?
Is the consent mechanism presented separately from other terms or conditions?
Is it possible for data subjects to revoke their consent at any time?
Does the product consider a minor's consent (below the age of 13-16)?
Is the processing of data for subjects under 13-16 years of age based on parental consent?
Are reasonable technological methods employed to confirm that parental consent is genuine?
Does the product provide clear and age-appropriate information to subjects under 13-16 years about the data being collected?
Is an option available for any minor to remove personal data?
Does the product process personal data that is not needed for identification?
If the processing objectives do not require identification, do you refrain from collecting additional identifying data?
Is the restriction of such non-identifiable data clearly marked within the product?
